title: DurationFormat
markdown:
# Intl.DurationFormat

**Experimental:** **This is an [experimental technology](/en-US/docs/MDN/Writing%5Fguidelines/Experimental%5Fdeprecated%5Fobsolete#experimental)**  
Check the [Browser compatibility table](#browser%5Fcompatibility) carefully before using this in production.

The **`Intl.DurationFormat`** object enables language-sensitive duration formatting.

## [Constructor](#constructor)

[Intl.DurationFormat()](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Intl/DurationFormat/DurationFormat)

Creates a new `Intl.DurationFormat` object.

## [Static methods](#static%5Fmethods)

[Intl.DurationFormat.supportedLocalesOf()](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Intl/DurationFormat/supportedLocalesOf)

Returns an array containing those of the provided locales that are supported without having to fall back to the runtime's default locale.

## [Instance properties](#instance%5Fproperties)

These properties are defined on `Intl.DurationFormat.prototype` and shared by all `Intl.DurationFormat` instances.

[Intl.DurationFormat.prototype.constructor](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Object/constructor)

The constructor function that created the instance object. For `Intl.DurationFormat` instances, the initial value is the [Intl.DurationFormat](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Intl/DurationFormat/DurationFormat) constructor.

`Intl.DurationFormat.prototype[@@toStringTag]`

The initial value of the [@@toStringTag](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Symbol/toStringTag) property is the string `"Intl.DurationFormat"`. This property is used in [Object.prototype.toString()](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Object/toString).

## [Instance methods](#instance%5Fmethods)

[Intl.DurationFormat.prototype.format()](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Intl/DurationFormat/format)

Getter function that formats a duration according to the locale and formatting options of this [DurationFormat](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Intl/DurationFormat) object.

[Intl.DurationFormat.prototype.formatToParts()](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Intl/DurationFormat/formatToParts)

Returns an [Array](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Array) of objects representing the formatted duration in parts.

[Intl.DurationFormat.prototype.resolvedOptions()](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Intl/DurationFormat/resolvedOptions)

Returns a new object with properties reflecting the locale and formatting options computed during initialization of the object.

## [Examples](#examples)

### [Using Intl.DurationFormat](#using%5Fintl.durationformat)

The examples below show how to use the `Intl.DurationFormat` object to format a duration object with various locales and styles.

```
const duration = {
  hours: 1,
  minutes: 46,
  seconds: 40,
};

// With style set to "long" and locale "fr-FR"
new Intl.DurationFormat("fr-FR", { style: "long" }).format(duration);
// "1 heure, 46 minutes et 40 secondes"

// With style set to "short" and locale "en"
new Intl.DurationFormat("en", { style: "short" }).format(duration);
// "1 hr, 46 min and 40 sec"

// With style set to "short" and locale "pt"
new Intl.DurationFormat("pt", { style: "narrow" }).format(duration);
// "1h 46min 40s"

```

## [Specifications](#specifications)

#### No specification found

No specification data found for `javascript.builtins.Intl.DurationFormat`.  
[Check for problems with this page](#on-github) or contribute a missing `spec_url` to [mdn/browser-compat-data](https://github.com/mdn/browser-compat-data). Also make sure the specification is included in [w3c/browser-specs](https://github.com/w3c/browser-specs).
